definition: to offer advice/to make a suggestion
to offer/to present/to dedicate/to donate/to show/to put on display/worthy person (old)
to calculate/to compute/to count/to regard as important/to plan/ruse/meter/gauge

sentences.english: The China Association for Promoting Democracy offered efforts to the country's general policy formulation and implementation.
sentences.chinese: 民进为国家大政方针的制定和实施献计出力。

sentences.english: They contribute to business strategy, and they transform that strategy through technology.
sentences.chinese: 他们为业务战略献计献策，通过技术改变这个战略。

sentences.english: To enable students to broaden their horizons, for the company's long-term development suggestions.
sentences.chinese: 使学员开拓视野，为公司的长远发展献计献策。

sentences.english: Vote on the traffickers , the masses have a lot of wisdom to offer advice and suggestions.
sentences.chinese: 就票贩子的情况，群众也有无穷的智慧来献计献策。
他为这个计划献计献策。

sentences.english: Kim hoped that people from all walks of life would, through the forum, produce good ideas for the prosperity of Asia.
sentences.chinese: 他希望各界人士能通过论坛为亚洲的繁荣献计献策。

definition: to offer advice/to make a suggestion
to put forward a suggestion (to sb in a senior position)/to offer a word of advice
to put forward plans and ideas (also derogatory)/to give advice (idiom)
to dispatch an army/to send troops
